commits.message: Add MySQL JSON blog post draft
Use semantic elements and clean up code

payload.description: Package scache implements a simple LRU cache as well as a cache wrapper for populating caches that deduplicates lookups for the same cache key.

commits.message: Update golangci-lint and move to official Github action workflow
Ensure that Noop does not need to be a pointer
Use custom context implementation for lookup cache to reduce allocations

issue.title: Radix aware of commands with BLOCK parameter?
issue.body:
Does Radix need to be aware of Redis commands with BLOCK parameter (eg. XREADGROUP) and handle them differently?
Eg. maybe TCP read timeout should be adjusted for commands with BLOCK parameter (block time added to read timeout?)?
How are connections supervised by radix? Does radix PING on connections to make sure they are still working? Then maybe radix should not PING on connections that are used for commands with BLOCK parameter (but maybe only "idle" connections (i.e. not used by a command) should be/are supervised?).

comment.body:
I'll be assuming you are talking about radix v4

> Does Radix need to be aware of Redis commands with BLOCK parameter (eg. XREADGROUP) and handle them differently?
Eg. maybe TCP read timeout should be adjusted for commands with BLOCK parameter (block time added to read timeout?)?

By default no timeout is set for commands. So blocking commands should work correctly.

> How are connections supervised by radix? Does radix PING on connections to make sure they are still working? Then maybe radix should not PING on connections that are used for commands with BLOCK parameter (but maybe only "idle" connections (i.e. not used by a command) should be/are supervised?).

A single connection (created by `Dial`) has no supervision.

Connections that are part of a `Pool` will be `PING`ed every few seconds (by default every `5/<pool size>` seconds). This can be configured with the [https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/mediocregopher/radix/v4#PoolConfig|PoolConfig].

Connections that are currently in use won't be `PING`ed.

Clusters and sentinel both use standard pools underneath and can take a custom `PoolConfig`.
